description: A '''descarga''' (literally ''discharge'' in [[Spanish language|Spanish]]) is an improvised [[jam session]] consisting of variations on [[Cuban music]] [[Theme (music)|themes]], primarily [[son montuno]], but also [[guajira (music)|guajira]], [[bolero]], [[guaracha]] and [[Cuban rumba|rumba]]. The genre is strongly influenced by [[jazz]] and it was developed in [[Havana]] during the 1950s. Important figures in the emergence of the genre were [[Cachao]], [[Julio Gutiérrez (musician)|Julio Gutiérrez]], [[Bebo Valdés]], [[Peruchín]] and [[Niño Rivera]] in Cuba, and [[Tito Puente]], [[Machito]] and [[Mario Bauzá]] in [[New York City|New York]]. Originally, descargas were promoted by record companies such as [[Panart]], Maype and Gema under the label '''Cuban jam sessions'''. From the 1960s, the descarga format was usually adapted by large [[salsa music|salsa]] ensembles, most notably the [[Fania All-Stars]].
